full_text: Censor & Associates Reporting and Transcription, Inc. Page 86 1 MR. TEIN: But you are misrepresenting the record and you are grandstanding for your client and it's wrong. So be quiet. And you know how to make an objection. Make it. Otherwise stop talking. 5 BY MR. TEIN: 7 Q. MR. LEOPOLD: Excuse me. 9 MR TEIN: If you want to leave the deposition, leave. But you'll be back here. 11 MR. LEOPOLD: Excuse me. If I could just make the record, instead of interrupting me, please. That's what we do professionally. 14 There's a recorder here. I'm certainly not being obstructionist. I'm going to make the record. 16 But we're going to act with some semblance of professionalism, hopefully, by all parties in the room. That goes to me, that goes to your co-counsel sitting behind you and next to you, the court reporter and everyone else in the room. 21 Everyone is entitled to that. 23 You've asked a question. She answered the question fully and she's not going to be harassed because you don't like the answer.
